locations.title: Indiahikes Opens The Bali Pass – Ruinsara Tal Trek
locations.description: Indiahikes has finally opened the Bali Pass – Ruinsara Tal Trek! Take a look and be one of the first to join our teams!

locations.title: 7 Best, Safest Himalayan Treks For Children
locations.description: Here are the best and safest Himalayan treks for children to do. We have listed 7 treks, all in Uttarakhand, and they make for a great experience for children.

locations.title: 6 Best Himalayan Treks In July, August And September
locations.description: It’s that time of the year when clouds come crashing down, leaving the skies bluer, the earth greener and the air, cleaner. What better way to experience this than in the mountains? We have chosen six of the best monsoon treks in the Himalayas in the months of July, August, and September. You might get a little wet, but it’s worth every drop! Take a look.

locations.title: Have You Used Budget Trekking Shoes?
locations.description: A study to understand the best budget trekking shoes available in India. If you have used any, click on the article and share your experience with us.

locations.title: Kashmir Great Lakes Vs Tarsar Marsar – Which Kashmir Trek To Choose?
locations.description: Our co-founder, who explored both Kashmir Great Lakes & Tarsar Marsar, helps you choose between the Kashmir treks by writing down their highlights and contrasts

locations.title: How To Avoid Knee Injuries On your Trek
locations.description: Knee injuries are common ailments trekkers face after their treks. But they’re completly avoidable. Here are steps to follow before, during and after your trek to avoid knee injuries.

locations.title: What We Look For In Applicants At Indiahikes
locations.description: Working at Indiahikes can be extremely rewarding, but that’s if you fit in and embrace the values of the organisation. Here’s what we look for in applicants

locations.title: Basic Precautions To Take On High Altitude Treks
locations.description: Here are basic precautions related to safety and altitude sickness. This is basic knowledge for anyone climbing above 12,000 ft.

locations.title: Trekking To Beas Kund Near Manali Over A Weekend: A Trek Blog
locations.description: The Beas Kund trek is one of the most popular trails that one can do on a longer weekend in Manali. The trek takes you away from the hustle and bustle of Manali city. Following the banks of Beas River expect great views of Pir Pinjal ranges. The meadows of Dhundi & Bakarthach are spectacular in […]
